title: Dermatitis Neglecta -- A Dirty Dermatosis: Report of Three Cases
patient: A 52-year-old female with classical adult type pityriasis rubra pilaris presented with progressive blackening and thickening of her facial skin since last 3 months. On examination, along with classical lesions of follicular hyperkeratotic papules in a typical distribution of pityriasis rubra pilaris, patient had hyperpigmented plaques mainly over the forehead, nose, periorbital, and perioral areas []. Initial soap water cleansing was followed by scrubbing with spirit; the areas were cleared to a great extent []. The lady admitted that she used to avoid scrubbing or soap water bath for last 3 months in fear of aggravation of her pre-existing skin disease.
